titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Brooklyn Dodgers collection ARC.297
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by John Zarrillo

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2015-03-17T13:30-0400

physdesc.extent: in five manuscript boxes and one oversize flat box

did.abstract: The collection contains scorecards, programs, yearbooks, magazines, clippings, scrapbooks, posters, and other items related to the Brooklyn Dodgers, dating from 1884 to 2002. It also includes a small amount of items related to the Los Angeles Dodgers. Of note are several late 19th century Brooklyn baseball scorecards.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use note
userestrict.p: Copyright status of individual items vary. Please consult library staff for more information.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Brooklyn Dodgers collection, ARC.297, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Archival Materials note
relatedmaterial.p: Los Angeles Dodgers centennial press kit photographs, circa 1990 (V1991.004)
Collection of Brooklyn Dodgers photographic portraits, circa 1940-1957 (ARC.265)

processinfo.head: Processing Information note
processinfo.p: This collection was originally part of the Brooklyn Ephemera collection (ARC.272). Due to its size and frequency of use, the Dodgers ephemera was removed to create this separate collection.
New Brooklyn Dodgers items will be added to this collection as they accrue.
The collection is minimally processed to the collection level.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Donor information has been noted on folders when available.
"When the Dodgers Left New York," lyrics by Tim Horrigan (Gift of Tim Horrigan, 1986)
World Series identification card, 1955, Walter O'Malley business card, and other ephemera (Gift of Irving Rudd, 1988)
Russ Meyer baseball card, 1955, and Sal Maglie baseball card, 1957 (Gift of Ellen Snyder, 1988)
Harry Lumley baseball card, 1909, and William Bergen baseball card, 1911 (Gift of Lew Lipset, circa 1988)
Score book pages, kept by Lothar Stetler, 1946 (Gift of Larry Stetler, 1992)
Programs, scorecards, yearbooks, ticket stubs, audio recordings, and pennant, 1940s-1990s (Gift of Joseph P. Cogan, 2005)
1940 game diary (scrapbook), and World Series ticket stubs, 1947, 1955 (Gift of Albert Greenberg, 2005, 2005.029)
1950 program and scorecard, and 1955 Brooklyn Dodgers anniversary magazine, 1996 (Gift of Michael Colin, 2011).
Brooklyn Dodgers official cover series binder, 1988 (Gift of Peter O'Malley, 2015, 2015.002)
Two scrapbooks, 1941-1954 (Gift of Claire Lambkin, date unknown)
Line Drives from the Dodgers newsletters, 1944-1956 (Gift of Frank Michel, date unknown)
Los Angeles Dodgers yearbook, 1958 (Gift of Mrs. Kenn Stryker-Rodda, date unknown)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection contains scorecards, programs, yearbooks, magazines, clippings, scrapbooks, posters, and other items related to the Brooklyn Dodgers, dating from 1884 to 2002. It also includes a small amount of items related to the Los Angeles Dodgers. Of note are several late 19th century Brooklyn baseball scorecards.
Box 1: Scorecards, 1884-1946; Programs and scorecards, 1953-1957 (see also Box 5); World Series programs, 1941-1955; Newsletters, 1944-1956; Yearbooks, 1949-1956
Box 2: Yearbooks, 1949-1957; Los Angeles Dodgers yearbook, 1958; Calendars, 1990-1991; Magazines, 1929-1990 (see also Box 5)

Box 3: Scrapbooks, 1941-1954; Clippings, 1941-2002; Ticket stubs, 1941-1957; Baseball cards, 1909-1986; Postcards, circa 1970s; new Brooklyn stadium ephemera, 1981-1984; Miscellaneous ephemera, 1950s-1990
Box 5: Clippings (photocopies), 1947; Program and scorecard, 1950; "When the Dodgers Left New York," lyrics by Tim Horrigan, 1985; 1955 Dodgers anniversary magazine, 1996

Box 6 (oversize): Gold Hours publication, "New Yorks vs. Brooklyns," 1900; 3 audio recordings (7" and 10" vinyl records), 1949-1957; Clippings, 1955; Brooklyn Dodgers official cover series binder, 1988; Dodgers Centennial yearbooks, 1990; Los Angeles Dodgers yearbook, 1991; Jackie Robinson Day posters and ephemera, 1997; Bring the Dodgers back to Brooklyn posters, 1990s; Pennant, 1990s; Color reproduction of 1956 schedule poster, circa 2002
